titleproper.value: Preliminary Inventory to the Fly Papers on Squatters' Rights <num>TAM.363</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-10-28T20:30:47</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

p.value: Materials donated by Fly in circa 2006. The accession number associated with this gift is 2006.022.
Fly is a visual artist who was involved in the 1980s squatters' rights movement in New York City's East Village which culminated in the Tompkins Square Park Police Riot of August 1988.

The collection consists of photographs, a scrapbook that contains clippings, artwork and photographs, and copies of zines, including <emph render="italic">Dog Days</emph> and <emph render="italic">Slug and Lettuce</emph>.

subject.value: Tompkins Square Park Riot, New York, N.Y., 1988.
